name: Root Cause Analysis (5 Whys)
description: Systematically drill down to identify the fundamental cause of problems by repeatedly asking 'Why?'. Essential for effective problem-solving and preventing recurrence.

structure.name: Problem Definition
structure.description: Clearly and specifically define the problem that needs to be solved

structure.name: First Why
structure.description: Ask 'Why does this problem occur?' and provide evidence-based answer

structure.name: Second Why
structure.description: Ask 'Why does [answer from previous step] happen?' and continue digging

structure.name: Third Why
structure.description: Continue the process until reaching the fundamental cause

structure.name: Fourth Why
structure.description: Keep drilling down - often 4-5 whys needed to reach root cause

structure.name: Fifth Why
structure.description: Final why to reach the root cause that can be addressed

structure.name: Solution Development
structure.description: Develop solutions that address the root cause, not symptoms

structure.name: Validation
structure.description: Verify that solutions will prevent problem recurrence

prompts: What exactly is the problem? Be specific and measurable.
Why does this problem occur? Look for direct causes.
Why does [previous answer] happen? Dig deeper into underlying causes.
Why does [second-level answer] occur? Continue investigating.
Why does [third-level answer] happen? Keep questioning assumptions.
Why does [fourth-level answer] occur? Reach the fundamental root cause.
How can we address this root cause to prevent the problem permanently?
How will we verify that our solution is effective?
when_to_use: When problems keep recurring despite previous fixes
When troubleshooting technical or operational issues
When quality issues need permanent resolution
When investigating customer complaints or service failures
When analyzing process inefficiencies or failures
when_not_to_use: When immediate action is required for safety or emergencies
When problems are simple and have obvious causes
When there's insufficient data or information available
When multiple independent causes create the problem (use fishbone diagram instead)

examples.title: Manufacturing Defect Analysis
examples.description: Problem: 15% defective parts. Why? Machine misalignment. Why? Worn bearings. Why? Poor maintenance schedule. Why? No preventive maintenance system. Why? Maintenance not prioritized. Solution: Implement preventive maintenance program.

examples.title: Customer Complaint Investigation
examples.description: Problem: Late deliveries. Why? Shipping delays. Why? Inadequate packaging time. Why? Staff shortage. Why: High turnover. Why: Poor compensation. Solution: Review compensation and retention strategies.

validation_status.validation_notes: Simple yet powerful problem-solving technique used globally in manufacturing and services
